00020 
00021 /* This identifier is passed to Direct3DCreate9 in order to ensure that an
00022  * application was built against the correct header files. This number is
00023  * incremented whenever a header (or other) change would require applications
00024  * to be rebuilt. If the version doesn't match, Direct3DCreate9 will fail.
00025  * (The number itself has no meaning.)*/
00026 
00027 #ifdef D3D_DEBUG_INFO
00028 #define D3D_SDK_VERSION   (32 | 0x80000000)
00029 #define D3D9b_SDK_VERSION (31 | 0x80000000)
00030 
00031 #else
00032 #define D3D_SDK_VERSION   32
00033 #define D3D9b_SDK_VERSION 31
00034 #endif
00035

00046     DECLARE_HANDLE(HMONITOR);
00047 #endif

00219 /*
00220  * DLL Function for creating a Direct3D9 object. This object supports
00221  * enumeration and allows the creation of Direct3DDevice9 objects.
00222  * Pass the value of the constant D3D_SDK_VERSION to this function, so
00223  * that the run-time can validate that your application was compiled
00224  * against the right headers.
00225  */
00226 
00227 IDirect3D9 * WINAPI Direct3DCreate9(UINT SDKVersion);
00228

00230  * Stubs for graphics profiling.
00231  */

00234 int WINAPI D3DPERF_EndEvent( void );
00235 void WINAPI D3DPERF_SetMarker( D3DCOLOR col, LPCWSTR wszName );
00236 void WINAPI D3DPERF_SetRegion( D3DCOLOR col, LPCWSTR wszName );
00237 BOOL WINAPI D3DPERF_QueryRepeatFrame( void );
00238 
00239 void WINAPI D3DPERF_SetOptions( DWORD dwOptions );
00240 DWORD WINAPI D3DPERF_GetStatus( void );

00253 
00254 DECLARE_INTERFACE_(IDirect3D9, IUnknown)
00255 {
00256     /*** IUnknown methods ***/
00257     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface)(THIS_ REFIID riid, void** ppvObj) PURE;
00258     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00259     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,Release)(THIS) PURE;
00260 
00261     /*** IDirect3D9 methods ***/
00262     STDMETHOD(RegisterSoftwareDevice)(THIS_ void* pInitializeFunction) PURE;
00263     STDMETHOD_(UINT, GetAdapterCount)(THIS) PURE;
00264     STDMETHOD(GetAdapterIdentifier)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,DWORD Flags,D3DADAPTER_IDENTIFIER9* pIdentifier) PURE;
00265     STDMETHOD_(UINT, GetAdapterModeCount)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DFORMAT Format) PURE;
00266     STDMETHOD(EnumAdapterModes)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DFORMAT Format,UINT Mode,D3DDISPLAYMODE* pMode) PURE;
00267     STDMETHOD(GetAdapterDisplayMode)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDISPLAYMODE* pMode) PURE;
00268     STDMETHOD(CheckDeviceType)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDEVTYPE DevType,D3DFORMAT AdapterFormat,D3DFORMAT BackBufferFormat,BOOL bWindowed) PURE;
00269     STDMETHOD(CheckDeviceFormat)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType,D3DFORMAT AdapterFormat,DWORD Usage,D3DRESOURCETYPE RType,D3DFORMAT CheckFormat) PURE;
00270     STDMETHOD(CheckDeviceMultiSampleType)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType,D3DFORMAT SurfaceFormat,BOOL Windowed,D3DMULTISAMPLE_TYPE MultiSampleType,DWORD* pQualityLevels) PURE;
00271     STDMETHOD(CheckDepthStencilMatch)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType,D3DFORMAT AdapterFormat,D3DFORMAT RenderTargetFormat,D3DFORMAT DepthStencilFormat) PURE;
00272     STDMETHOD(CheckDeviceFormatConversion)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType,D3DFORMAT SourceFormat,D3DFORMAT TargetFormat) PURE;
00273     STDMETHOD(GetDeviceCaps)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType,D3DCAPS9* pCaps) PURE;
00274     STDMETHOD_(HMONITOR, GetAdapterMonitor)(THIS_ UINT Adapter) PURE;
00275     STDMETHOD(CreateDevice)(THIS_ UINT Adapter,D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType,HWND hFocusWindow,DWORD BehaviorFlags,D3DPRESENT_PARAMETERS* pPresentationParameters,IDirect3DDevice9** ppReturnedDeviceInterface) PURE;
00276     
00277     #ifdef D3D_DEBUG_INFO
00278     LPCWSTR Version;
00279     #endif
00280 };

00347 DECLARE_INTERFACE_(IDirect3DDevice9, IUnknown)
00348 {
00349     /*** IUnknown methods ***/
00350     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface)(THIS_ REFIID riid, void** ppvObj) PURE;
00351     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00352     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,Release)(THIS) PURE;
00353 
00354     /*** IDirect3DDevice9 methods ***/
00355     STDMETHOD(TestCooperativeLevel)(THIS) PURE;
00356     STDMETHOD_(UINT, GetAvailableTextureMem)(THIS) PURE;
00357     STDMETHOD(EvictManagedResources)(THIS) PURE;
00358     STDMETHOD(GetDirect3D)(THIS_ IDirect3D9** ppD3D9) PURE;
00359     STDMETHOD(GetDeviceCaps)(THIS_ D3DCAPS9* pCaps) PURE;
00360     STDMETHOD(GetDisplayMode)(THIS_ UINT iSwapChain,D3DDISPLAYMODE* pMode) PURE;
00361     STDMETHOD(GetCreationParameters)(THIS_ D3DDEVICE_CREATION_PARAMETERS *pParameters) PURE;
00362     STDMETHOD(SetCursorProperties)(THIS_ UINT XHotSpot,UINT YHotSpot,IDirect3DSurface9* pCursorBitmap) PURE;
00363     STDMETHOD_(void, SetCursorPosition)(THIS_ int X,int Y,DWORD Flags) PURE;
00364     STDMETHOD_(BOOL, ShowCursor)(THIS_ BOOL bShow) PURE;
00365     STDMETHOD(CreateAdditionalSwapChain)(THIS_ D3DPRESENT_PARAMETERS* pPresentationParameters,IDirect3DSwapChain9** pSwapChain) PURE;
00366     STDMETHOD(GetSwapChain)(THIS_ UINT iSwapChain,IDirect3DSwapChain9** pSwapChain) PURE;
00367     STDMETHOD_(UINT, GetNumberOfSwapChains)(THIS) PURE;

01731 /****************************************************************************
01732  * Flags for SetPrivateData method on all D3D9 interfaces
01733  *
01734  * The passed pointer is an IUnknown ptr. The SizeOfData argument to SetPrivateData
01735  * must be set to sizeof(IUnknown*). Direct3D will call AddRef through this
01736  * pointer and Release when the private data is destroyed. The data will be
01737  * destroyed when another SetPrivateData with the same GUID is set, when
01738  * FreePrivateData is called, or when the D3D9 object is freed.
01739  ****************************************************************************/
01740 #define D3DSPD_IUNKNOWN                         0x00000001L

01760 // This flag causes the D3D runtime not to alter the focus 
01761 // window in any way. Use with caution- the burden of supporting
01762 // focus management events (alt-tab, etc.) falls on the 
01763 // application, and appropriate responses (switching display
01764 // mode, etc.) should be coded.
